data.name: OoNee Sea Urchin Ranch
data.description:
Oo-Nee Sea Ranch is on a mission to Build sustainable seafood supply chains and regenerate PNW coastal communities and ecosystems.

We invest in underserved coastal communities here in the Pacific Northwest by commercializing regenerative species like sea urchin, kelp, and sea cucumber - while improving the health of our coastal ecosystems with sustainable jobs at the same time. 

OoNee is building a vertically integrated sea ranch that includes harvesting, ranching, and processing purple urchin that are proliferating by the billions along our coastal marine waters. Through the vertical sea ranch, we will bring a steady, dependable source of local seafood to both local and international markets - bringing with it a revitalization of critical maritime expertise, equipment, and capital to ensure a scalable food supply chain and ecosystem that is resilient in the face of climate change and its impact on our Pacific Northwest coasts.

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
❗ Announcement❗
We would like to give our warmest E Komo Mai (welcome) to the following companies who have been selected to join the Hatch Blue portfolio:

b.fab GmbH: b.fab uses CO2 to produce a protein feed ingredient that can replace fishmeal in aquafeeds. 

Aquasend: Aquasend is a PME company developing real-time water quality monitoring (DO & temperature) improving overall fish health and reducing costs.

AQUIT: AQUIT is commercializing a platform technology that identifies and produces antimicrobial peptides (AMPs) that improve the immune system of salmon.

Ai Control Technologies: AI Control Technologies Inc. (AiCT) specializes in air and water managed depth control systems with extensive applications across multiple verticals including aquaculture, and marine construction.

TransparentSea Farm: TransparentSea specializes in land-based production systems for shrimp using proprietary, clearwater technology.

OoNee Sea Ranch Sea Ranch: Oo-Nee is a company focused on transforming ecologically destructive sea urchins into a high-value culinary delicacy.

MarineSitu: MarineSitu provides underwater monitoring technologies that enable multi-year field deployments, software for data acquisition and real time processing, and cloud based data management services.

Cultimar Technologies: Cultimar Technologies develops cutting edge technologies that allow for scalable cultivation of valuable finfish absent in aquaculture production beginning with Red Snapper (Lutjanus campechanus).

KnipBio: produces a single-cell protein from a methylotrophic bacteria, with functional properties increasing stress resilience in juvenile fish and shrimp.

? These selected participants were initiated into the new CREST accelerator in Hawaiʻi on July 8th. Read on about their innovative companies looking to make a difference in the world of aquaculture at The Fish Site: https://lnkd.in/gXrth46Y

Applications will continue to be open throughout the year with the next chance to get started on your journey in Hawaiʻi next February, 2025! 

? Join this esteemed group of changemakers: https://lnkd.in/gNykfzpd

Hawaii Technology Development Corporation, Aqua-Spark, NELHA, Hatch Innovation Services, The Fish Site, Benedict Tan 陈勇安, Wayne Murphy, Tanja Knabenschuh Hoel, Moritz Mueller, Anandi Etsebeth, Claude Kaplan, Carsten Krome, Gonçalo Abreu Santos, Caitriona Kelleher
#aquaculture #aquafeed #marinebiotechnology #bluefood #blueeconomy

company_updates_collection.description: Thank you to Washington Maritime Blue for hosting such an important event for everyone in the PNW #BlueEconomy. Honored to bring awareness to our kelp forest and #sustainableaquaculture!

Subsidizing large corporate farms is not the same as small family-owned farms and producers. Can you imagine if we stopped subsidizing corn and started investing in regenerative agriculture and aquaculture?

#regenerativeagriculture
#regenerativeaquaculture

We are at a critical juncture of being able to save what we have left, not only to revitalize the coastal kelp beds but to revitalize coastal communities and reimagine a new way of being in harmony with what nature is telling us. #HelpNatureHeal

This is a huge milestone for the EU. 
#carbonremoval #eelgrass

Huge win for AUS!
#RestoreKelpforests #EatMoreUrchin
Great article in the NYTimes on sunflower sea stars and captive breeding programs. #KelpForestRestoration

OCVA’s vintage Airstream “Stella” was on the scene of the Holy Toledo! vanlife and overlanding rendezvous, held on the Yaquina River & Bay in Toledo on July 20 to 24. 

Stella is an ambassador for OCVA’s Oregon Ocean Cluster Initiative (OOCI), whose goal is to support coastal communities and build a more resilient and robust regional food economy. OOCI focuses on enhancing the use of local sustainable seafood in small businesses through infrastructure investments, workforce training, and partnership development. 

For her inaugural season, Stella has been on the road promoting local producers and increasing the availability of seafood and aquaculture products in our coastal communities. She made her debut at Waldport’s Beach, Bike, and Blues event in May, and will appear again at The People’s Coast Summit in October. 

At Holy Toledo, Stella hosted demonstrations and workshops from Alanna Kieffer of Shifting Tides and Oregon Seaweed, Chef Maylin Chavez Navarro of Nácar Oyster, and Aaron and Jacob from OoNee Sea Ranch. Holy Toledo participants also had the chance to sample gazpacho made by The Buslife Kitchen and local catch cooked up by Chef Sarah from Wildflower’s Kitchen.

At Stella, the 261 Holy Toledo! attendees could pre-order seafare from Chelsea Rose Seafood to cook with during the event. The OOCI team also highlighted local shelf-stable products for attendees to use throughout the weekend, demonstrating the value of keeping Oregon seafare ingredients on hand as pantry staples. 

Keep an eye out for Stella as she travels The People’s Coast, sharing the amazing bounty of Oregon seafare with everyone she meets.

More about Stella: https://lnkd.in/gKeGBiJc. 

More about the Oregon Ocean Cluster Initiative: https://lnkd.in/gmbsgVZA.
Excited to be part of the next Maritime wave with Joshua M Berger and his team of connectors, innovators, and key stakeholders!

Ai Control Technologies: AI Control Technologies Inc. (AiCT) specializes in air and water managed depth control systems with extensive applications across multiple verticals including aquaculture, and marine construction.

TransparentSea Farm: TransparentSea specializes in land-based production systems for shrimp using proprietary, clearwater technology.

OoNee Sea Ranch Sea Ranch: Oo-Nee is a company focused on transforming ecologically destructive sea urchins into a high-value culinary delicacy.

MarineSitu: MarineSitu provides underwater monitoring technologies that enable multi-year field deployments, software for data acquisition and real time processing, and cloud based data management services.

Cultimar Technologies: Cultimar Technologies develops cutting edge technologies that allow for scalable cultivation of valuable finfish absent in aquaculture production beginning with Red Snapper (Lutjanus campechanus).

KnipBio: produces a single-cell protein from a methylotrophic bacteria, with functional properties increasing stress resilience in juvenile fish and shrimp.

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
A deep dive with Aaron Huang, founder of OoNee Sea Urchin Ranch, into the world of #seaurchin ranching and its connections to high-end fish #restaurants, many of which fly their sea urchins in from Japan. Over the past decade, a warm water blob off the U.S. West Coast has caused sea urchins to overgraze the #kelp forests, leading to a massive population boom of urchins, the collapse of kelp ecosystems, and the rise of countless “zombie” sea urchins—urchins that prevent the kelp from regrowing without dying themselves.

Why should we care? Because this phenomenon is happening everywhere—whether it’s invasive species or extreme #weather events, #ecosystems are collapsing, and without smart intervention, they won’t recover. OoNee's solution is to harvest the sea urchins threatening the remaining kelp, fatten them up, and sell them to the growing market for high-end #seafood. What can we learn from this approach and apply to other ecosystems that are out of balance?

This is part of the Regenerative Aquaculture series supported by The Nest Family Office.

https://lnkd.in/gQdGQYUv

company_updates_collection.description: Thank you to Washington Maritime Blue for hosting such an important event for everyone in the PNW #BlueEconomy. Honored to bring awareness to our kelp forest and #sustainableaquaculture!

Subsidizing large corporate farms is not the same as small family-owned farms and producers. Can you imagine if we stopped subsidizing corn and started investing in regenerative agriculture and aquaculture?

#regenerativeagriculture
#regenerativeaquaculture

We are at a critical juncture of being able to save what we have left, not only to revitalize the coastal kelp beds but to revitalize coastal communities and reimagine a new way of being in harmony with what nature is telling us. #HelpNatureHeal

This 'blob' was one of the first anomalies that got mainstream media's attention over a decade ago. Since then things have only gotten weirder. Our ecosystem is changing, and we need to find ways to adapt and help it, and in the process help our own societies adapt. 

#kelpforestrestoration
#restorativeaquaculture
Thanks to the Hatch Blue team for organizing such a great demo day last week. Great to meet the Singapore community of impact investors, funds, and partners to push restorative aquaculture forward!
Thanks for Koen van Seijen and the regen podcast for giving voice to restorative aquaculture within the regen community!

A deep dive with Aaron Huang, founder of OoNee Sea Urchin Ranch, into the world of #seaurchin ranching and its connections to high-end fish #restaurants, many of which fly their sea urchins in from Japan. Over the past decade, a warm water blob off the U.S. West Coast has caused sea urchins to overgraze the #kelp forests, leading to a massive population boom of urchins, the collapse of kelp ecosystems, and the rise of countless “zombie” sea urchins—urchins that prevent the kelp from regrowing without dying themselves.

Why should we care? Because this phenomenon is happening everywhere—whether it’s invasive species or extreme #weather events, #ecosystems are collapsing, and without smart intervention, they won’t recover. OoNee's solution is to harvest the sea urchins threatening the remaining kelp, fatten them up, and sell them to the growing market for high-end #seafood. What can we learn from this approach and apply to other ecosystems that are out of balance?

This is part of the Regenerative Aquaculture series supported by The Nest Family Office.

https://lnkd.in/gQdGQYUv

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
?️? New Podcast Episode is LIVE: The Future of Uni & Urchin Ranching! ?♻️

Sea urchins are shaping the future of regenerative aquaculture. But how can we sustainably harvest and ranch them while restoring our oceans? ??
On today’s episode of The Business of Aquaculture Podcast, we sit down with Aaron Huang, CEO of OoNee.com, to explore how his team of divers, researchers, and technologists are redefining seafood production while combating climate change.

? What you’ll learn in this episode:
✅ How sustainable urchin ranching works—from diving to processing
✅ The climate impact on marine ecosystems and how innovation is protecting coastal waters
✅ The challenges of scaling a niche seafood product while maintaining ocean health ?

? If you care about sustainability, seafood, and the future of regenerative aquaculture—this episode is for you! ?

? Tune in now & be part of the conversation! https://lnkd.in/d2WrW4gE

? **What’s your take on sustainable urchin ranching? Let’s discuss in the comments!**?

? Tag a fellow ocean advocate & share this episode!

#Podcast #Aquaculture #SustainableSeafood #UrchinRanching #ClimateAction #RegenerativeFarming #FutureOfFood

company_updates_collection.description: Curious why urchin ranching can help the underwater ecosystem and restore kelp forests? Read our write up in The Fish Site!
Thanks to Oregon Business magazine for bringing our restorative efforts to light and highlighting the challenges and opportunities for our sea urchin ranch!

This 'blob' was one of the first anomalies that got mainstream media's attention over a decade ago. Since then things have only gotten weirder. Our ecosystem is changing, and we need to find ways to adapt and help it, and in the process help our own societies adapt. 

#kelpforestrestoration
#restorativeaquaculture
Thanks to the Hatch Blue team for organizing such a great demo day last week. Great to meet the Singapore community of impact investors, funds, and partners to push restorative aquaculture forward!
Thanks for Koen van Seijen and the regen podcast for giving voice to restorative aquaculture within the regen community!

company_updates_collection.description: This is a huge step in the right direction for monitoring kelp forests worldwide.

Sharing harvest with our friends at Washington Maritime Blue Joshua M Berger. 

#RestorativeAquaculture #Saveourkelp

This week, researchers identified the pathogen responsible for sea star wasting disease: Vibrio pectenicida. The disease has devastated sea star populations along the Pacific Coast since 2013, including over 90% of sunflower sea stars — a key predator of sea urchins.

The loss of these predators contributed to unchecked sea urchin grazing, accelerating the decline of kelp forests across the region.

At OoNee, our work centers on restoring balance to this system. By harvesting and fattening undernourished urchins, we reduce pressure on kelp beds while building a regenerative, high-value seafood product.

This discovery is an important step forward for marine science and ecosystem recovery. It opens the door for targeted sea star restoration — which, paired with efforts like ours, can help stabilize coastal food webs and support long-term kelp recovery.

We’re encouraged by the progress and remain committed to regenerative aquaculture solutions that benefit both ocean ecosystems and coastal economies.

https://lnkd.in/gnxey2BA

#regenerativeaquaculture #marineecology #kelprestoration #bluefoods #oceanhealth

Why is workforce development so critical to the development of the Blue Economy? Restoring ecosystems and developing new skills is vital. Human capital is and always will be the foundation of a healthy, sustainable society. 

Thanks to OPB radio for highlighting our work with NorthWest Oregon Works.

#BlueEconomy
#WorkforceDevelopment
Thanks Lourdes Gant ?for highlighting us and spotlighting urchin ranching in the PNW!

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_author_headline: Manager at Toniic, host of the Podcast Investing in Regenerative Agriculture and Food
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
A deep dive with Aaron Huang, founder of OoNee Sea Urchin Ranch, into the world of #seaurchin ranching and its connections to high-end fish #restaurants, many of which fly their sea urchins in from Japan. Over the past decade, a warm water blob off the U.S. West Coast has caused sea urchins to overgraze the #kelp forests, leading to a massive population boom of urchins, the collapse of kelp ecosystems, and the rise of countless “zombie” sea urchins—urchins that prevent the kelp from regrowing without dying themselves.

Why should we care? Because this phenomenon is happening everywhere—whether it’s invasive species or extreme #weather events, #ecosystems are collapsing, and without smart intervention, they won’t recover. OoNee's solution is to harvest the sea urchins threatening the remaining kelp, fatten them up, and sell them to the growing market for high-end #seafood. What can we learn from this approach and apply to other ecosystems that are out of balance?

This is part of the Regenerative Aquaculture series supported by The Nest Family Office.

https://lnkd.in/gQdGQYUv

company_updates_collection.description: This is a huge step in the right direction for monitoring kelp forests worldwide.

This week, researchers identified the pathogen responsible for sea star wasting disease: Vibrio pectenicida. The disease has devastated sea star populations along the Pacific Coast since 2013, including over 90% of sunflower sea stars — a key predator of sea urchins.

The loss of these predators contributed to unchecked sea urchin grazing, accelerating the decline of kelp forests across the region.

At OoNee, our work centers on restoring balance to this system. By harvesting and fattening undernourished urchins, we reduce pressure on kelp beds while building a regenerative, high-value seafood product.

This discovery is an important step forward for marine science and ecosystem recovery. It opens the door for targeted sea star restoration — which, paired with efforts like ours, can help stabilize coastal food webs and support long-term kelp recovery.

We’re encouraged by the progress and remain committed to regenerative aquaculture solutions that benefit both ocean ecosystems and coastal economies.

https://lnkd.in/gnxey2BA

#regenerativeaquaculture #marineecology #kelprestoration #bluefoods #oceanhealth
